content.original: The Lightning was designed for the Star League by Curtiss Industries as a hovercraft combat vehicle designed to take down slow BattleMechs and vehicles. Some commanders would combine several Lightnings into a temporary compact unit to crush the hostile line, using their maneuverability to break up formations. A interesting feature of the Lightning is a low wing mounted on the rear of the vehicle that increases the vehicle's stability at high speed. Biome Restrictions: None. Movement: 11/17 hexes / 330/510 meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 120 20 Left 85 20 Right 85 20 Rear 50 20 Total 340 80 Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile

content.original: Originally developed by Vitesse Vehicles of Terra in 2611, the Prowler Multi-Terrain-Vehicle was the most common hostile and exotic environment military-grade exploration vehicles. The Prowler was almost unsurpassed in its niche, the design proving popular enough for Vitesse to halt production and merely license the design to manufacturers across the Inner Sphere and Periphery. While never produced in large numbers, all post–Star League era Successor State militaries maintained a number of the vehicle for combat on their most inhospitable planets. Biome Restrictions: None. Movement: 4/6 hexes / 120/180 meters. Armor: Armor (C) Structure: Environmental Sealing Values A S Front 145 30 Left 125 30 Right 125 30 Rear 100 30 Turret 135 30 Total 630 150 Quirk: Enhanced FPE Can carry 1 Battle Armor Squads. Has firing ports.

content.original: Developed by the Society to bolster their forces, the Rhino (S) is a converted series of SLDF Rhinos pulled out of Society owned Brian Caches. Stripping off the original weapons array, the Society opted to utilize weapons that would compensate for the poor skills of their troops. Clan Medium Pulse Lasers replace the Inner Sphere versions, while the LRM-20’s are swapped for Streak LRM-20’s. The front mounted LRM-10 is removed in favour of a pair of Streak SRM-6's and the Guardian ECM has been swapped for a Nova CEWS. The rest of the tank is unchanged from the original spec. Biome Restrictions: None. Movement: 3/5 hexes / 90/150 meters. Armor: Armor (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 345 40 Left 275 40 Right 275 40 Rear 200 40 Turret 310 40 Total 1405 200 Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long

content.original: As a Second-Line mech, the Incubus was a prime candidate for Society engineers to refit into a light mech capable of being integrated into Society formations easily. The Incubus Z drops the Large Pulse Laser for a Large Supra Laser and drops the ER Medium for a Nova CEWS. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Laser Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

content.original: Despite the Society's distaste for the Warrior Caste's insistence on adhering to zellbrigen, they did see value in attempting to best these warriors in one-on-one combat. The Vapor Eagle Z variant utilizes a Snub-Nosed PPC and a pair of MRM15s to brutalize close-combatants and relies on its speed, Nova CEWS, and torso-mounted cockpit for survivability. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

content.original: The Torso Cockpit has long been a dream of BattleMech designers. By moving the MechWarrior to a more heavily protected area, an army would be able to keep its more experienced soldiers in the fight a lot longer. The Advanced Torso Cockpit features several systems upgrades including an advanced Fire Control System.

content.original: Arrow V (S)
content.prevOriginal: Arrow V (S)
content.content: Arrow V (S)

content.original: Designed to take down a multitude of targets, including aerospace assets and small craft, the Arrow V Missile features a powerful warhead capable of being reconfigured in the launcher moments before use to allow the pilot to cater the missile to his needs. Despite the project being rejected by Clan leadership, Society member cells continued its development and eventual production. The Arrow V utilizes advanced internal fire control systems, included Streak technology, which render it incapable of indirect fire. Uses ArrowV Ammo.

content.original: HVAC/10 (S)
content.prevOriginal: HVAC/10 (S)
content.content: HVAC/10 (S)

content.original: The Hypervelocity Autocannon (HVAC) family of weapons is based on the Autocannon. While they have the same damage classes, they're capable of firing much further. Once members of the Society discovered the use of these weapons in the Inner Sphere, they immediate developed and proposed their own prototypes to Clan leadership. While rejected by the Khans, HVAC (S) cannons were found amongst the Society 'Mechs and vehicles used during the Wars of Reaving. Uses HVAC10 Ammo.

content.original: Heavy Gauss Rifle (S)
content.prevOriginal: Heavy Gauss Rifle (S)
content.content: Heavy Gauss Rifle (S)

content.original: From all reports it seemed that, despite numerous attempts, Clan Scientists never fully realized a Mech-scale Heavy Gauss Rifle. This is only partially true, by 3062 members of the Society had come close to finishing their secret development a prototype that rivaled the new Heavy Gauss Rifle being sported by Inner Sphere forces. Rushed into production at the onset of the Jihad and Wars of Reaving, the Clan Heavy Gauss Rifle may benefit from the same weight-saving technologies as Clan Gauss Rifle but has considerable reliability issues and the vast capacitor banks can cause an incredible explosion if damaged. Uses Heavy Gauss Ammo. VOLATILE!

content.original: Light Ultra Gauss Rifle
content.prevOriginal: Light Ultra Gauss Rifle
content.content: Light Ultra Gauss Rifle

content.original: The Light Ultra Gauss Rifle started life is a discarded attempt at further reducing Gauss Rifle weights as the damage output was too low to be acceptable. It was not until a cabal of Society scientists applied several lessons learned from the Hyper Assualt Gauss rifle projects that the abondoned light-weight gauss rifle project gained new life as the Light Ultra Gauss Rifle. The LUGR is capable of firing at twice the rate of standard Gauss rifles with a minor risk of jamming like it's conventional Ultra Autocannon cousins. Uses Light Gauss Ammo. VOLATILE!

content.original: MRM-15 (S)
content.prevOriginal: MRM-15 (S)
content.content: MRM-15 (S)

content.original: After witnessing the relative success of the cheap, easy to manufacture, Medium Range Missile systems utilized in the Inner Sphere, several Society cells began secret development their own versions for their forces. Though these new Clan-Tech MRM systems benefited from the same weight-saving technologies as Clan-Tech SRMs and LRMs, Society leaders decided that additional tubes were necessary to ensure that the lesser-trained Society pilots could effectively saturate the target area. Uses Clan MRM Ammo.
content.prevOriginal: After witnessing the relative success of the cheap, easy to manufacture, Medium Range Missile systems utilized in the Inner Sphere, several Society cells began secret development their own versions for their forces. Though these new Clan-Tech MRM systems benefited from the same weight-saving technologies as Clan-Tech SRMs and LRMs, Society leaders decided that additional tubes were necessary to ensure that the lesser-trained Society pilots could effectively saturate the target area. Uses Clan MRM Ammo.
content.content: Увидев во Внутренней Сфере относительный успех дешевых и простых в производстве ракетных систем средней дальности, несколько ячеек Общества начали тайную разработку собственных версий для своих войск. Несмотря на то, что новые клановые MRM использовали те же технологии экономии веса, что и клановые SRM и LRM, лидеры Общества решили, что необходимо добавить больше стволов для того, чтобы малообученные пилоты Общества могли эффективно заливать целевую область. Uses Clan MRM Ammo.

content.original: Streak NARC Launcher (S)
content.prevOriginal: Streak NARC Launcher (S)
content.content: Streak NARC Launcher (S)

content.original: Utilizing Streak missile guidance technology, the Streak NARC Launcher is an attempt to ensure pilots attach the pod to the correct target. This launcher fires a single NARC beacon that attaches itself to the enemy and emits a homing signal for all friendly weapons. Uses Streak NARC Ammo.

content.original: Heavy Plasma Cannon (S)
content.prevOriginal: Heavy Plasma Cannon (S)
content.content: Heavy Plasma Cannon (S)

content.original: Plasma Cannons accelerate and superheat a cartridge of 'plastic foam' into an excited state and release it as plasma, creating a tremendous kinetic and thermal impact. Society scientists developed the Heavy Plasma Cannon as a deadly combination of heat build-up and immediate material destruction resulting in a weapon that generates more heat than the Clan Plasma Cannon while hitting about as hard as an ERPPC at close ranges all at the cost of tremendous heat build-up.VOLATILE! Uses Plasma Ammo.

content.original: SnubNose PPC (S)
content.prevOriginal: SnubNose PPC (S)
content.content: SnubNose PPC (S)

content.original: The Snub-Nose PPC is to a Particle Projector Cannon as a sawed-off shotgun is to a shotgun. This version of the PPC is slightly lighter than a standard PPC, but its energy discharge trails off considerably faster, leading to shorter range and reduced damage capacity over range. Despite almost no Snub-Nose PPCs surviving the Exodus, Society scientists saw enough potential to apply more modern PPC technology to the orginal design, leading to a higher damage capacity and less damage drop-off out to long ranges.

content.original: FCS TC MKII
content.prevOriginal: FCS TC MKII
content.content: FCS TC MKII

content.original: Targeting Computers are sophisticated pieces of electronics that, unlike normal targeting systems, physically help MechWarriors target their opponents. Recoil compensators and gyroscopic stabilizers are used to prevent normal weapon drift from factors such as recoil and movement while the computer accounts for atmospheric and other conditions to present an accurate ''lead'' on the target. This allows for more surgical precision of weapons fire, especially with naturally accurate systems.
content.prevOriginal: Targeting Computers are sophisticated pieces of electronics that, unlike normal targeting systems, physically help MechWarriors target their opponents. Recoil compensators and gyroscopic stabilizers are used to prevent normal weapon drift from factors such as recoil and movement while the computer accounts for atmospheric and other conditions to present an accurate ''lead'' on the target. This allows for more surgical precision of weapons fire, especially with naturally accurate systems.
content.content: Компьютеры наведения - это сложные электронные устройства, которые, в отличие от обычных систем наведения, физически помогают мехвоинам наводить оружие на противника. В то время, как компенсаторы отдачи и гироскопические стабилизаторы помогают предотвратить обычное смещения оружия от отдачи и движения, компьютер наведения учитывает атмосферные и другие условия, чтобы обеспечить аккуратное ведение цели. Это позволяет повысить точность стрельбы до хирургического уровня, особенно если не поскупиться на качественное железо.

content.original: Advances in Material Sciences since and recovered from the Star League in combination with RISC ingenuity alloed the creation of this Armor. content.original: FCS Improved TC
content.prevOriginal: FCS Improved TC
content.content: FCS Improved TC

content.original: Targeting Computers are sophisticated pieces of electronics that, unlike normal targeting systems, physically help MechWarriors target their opponents. Recoil compensators and gyroscopic stabilizers are used to prevent normal weapon drift from factors such as recoil and movement while the computer accounts for atmospheric and other conditions to present an accurate ''lead'' on the target. This allows for more surgical precision of weapons fire, especially with naturally accurate systems. This system has been further improved to help the mechwarrior to aim more accurate in all ranges.
content.prevOriginal: Targeting Computers are sophisticated pieces of electronics that, unlike normal targeting systems, physically help MechWarriors target their opponents. Recoil compensators and gyroscopic stabilizers are used to prevent normal weapon drift from factors such as recoil and movement while the computer accounts for atmospheric and other conditions to present an accurate ''lead'' on the target. This allows for more surgical precision of weapons fire, especially with naturally accurate systems. This system has been further improved to help the mechwarrior to aim more accurate in all ranges.
content.content: Компьютеры наведения - это сложные электронные устройства, которые, в отличие от обычных систем наведения, физически помогают мехвоинам наводить оружие на противника. В то время, как компенсаторы отдачи и гироскопические стабилизаторы помогают предотвратить обычное смещения оружия от отдачи и движения, компьютер наведения учитывает атмосферные и другие условия, чтобы обеспечить аккуратное ведение цели. Это позволяет повысить точность стрельбы до хирургического уровня, особенно если не поскупиться на качественное железо. Эта система была доработана, чтобы помочь мехвоину точнее целиться на всех дистанциях.

content.original: The Anti-Missile System is used to destroy missiles before they strike their target. This AMS was designed by Skobel Mechworks in coordination with RISC, replacing most of a BattleMech's Sensor Suite and Dedicating it to Interception Systems. It is able to Intercept almost any and all Missiles in Range. Uses AMS Ammo.

content.original: MMS-10
content.prevOriginal: MMS-10
content.content: MMS-10

content.original: The Micro Missile System is based on an attempt to improve on the aging MRM. Marrying advanced Guidance and Control Systems to the Launcher helped overcome several innate flaws of the MRM, yet it was ultimately deemed a failure because of prohibitively expensive and hard to produce Munitions. Uses Micro Missile Ammo.

content.original: MML-10 (RISC)
content.prevOriginal: MML-10 (RISC)
content.content: MML-10 (RISC)

content.original: RISC Engineers took an interest in the Mercenary-created MML systems and tried to adapt them for a more high tech battlefield. Applying weight saving technologies similar to the LBX autocannons allowed them to increase volley sizes. Uses Clan SRM/LRM Ammo. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to toggle between LRM or SRM.
content.prevOriginal: RISC Engineers took an interest in the Mercenary-created MML systems and tried to adapt them for a more high tech battlefield. Applying weight saving technologies similar to the LBX autocannons allowed them to increase volley sizes. Uses Clan SRM/LRM Ammo. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to toggle between LRM or SRM.
content.content: Инженеры RISC заинтересовались системами MML, созданными наёмниками, и попытались улучшить их до высокотехнологичного уровня. Применение технологий снижения веса, аналогичных автопушкам LBX, позволило им увеличить величину залпа. Uses Clan SRM/LRM Ammo. Левый клик на шанс попасть (в бою), чтобы переключиться между LRM и SRM.

content.original: Streak MML-3
content.prevOriginal: Streak MML-3
content.content: Streak MML-3

content.original: Marrying the Streak System from Clantech Launchers to a MML selector system allowed RISC Engineers to create this fine Marvel of Technology. Unusually for them, it's unlikely to explode. Uses Clan Streak SRM/LRM Ammo. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to toggle between LRM or SRM.
content.prevOriginal: Marrying the Streak System from Clantech Launchers to a MML selector system allowed RISC Engineers to create this fine Marvel of Technology. Unusually for them, it's unlikely to explode. Uses Clan Streak SRM/LRM Ammo. Left Click on Chance to hit during battle to toggle between LRM or SRM.
content.content: Сочетание клановой системы Streak с селекторной системой MML позволило инженерам RISC создать это чудо техники. И оно не стремится взорваться, редкое свойство для их творений. Uses Clan Streak SRM/LRM Ammo. Левый клик на шанс попасть (в бою), чтобы переключиться между LRM и SRM.

content.original: Heavy MRM-45
content.prevOriginal: Heavy MRM-45
content.content: Heavy MRM-45

content.original: Based upon Advances by the Combine and with knowledge from Clan Missile Launchers, RISC Engineers developed the Heavy MRM, able to deliver a heavier payload with guided Missiles at extremely large Volley sizes. Due to the large strain from the generated forces, an extra sturdy chassis is needed which makes the launchers in practice only useable on Superheavy 'Mechs. Uses H-MRM Ammo.

content.original: R-NARC Launcher
content.prevOriginal: R-NARC Launcher
content.content: R-NARC Launcher

content.original: This Launcher fires a single NARC beacon that attaches itself to the enemy and emits a homing signal for all friendly weapons. Uses NARC Ammo.
content.prevOriginal: This Launcher fires a single NARC beacon that attaches itself to the enemy and emits a homing signal for all friendly weapons. Uses NARC Ammo.
content.content: Эта пусковая установка стреляет одним маяком NARC, который прикрепляется к противнику и излучает сигнал самонаведения для всех дружественных орудий. Uses NARC Ammo.

content.original: Plasma Carbine
content.prevOriginal: Plasma Carbine
content.content: Plasma Carbine

content.original: Based on recovered Schematics from a Pirate outpost, RISC Technicians have taken an interest in this Variable State Plasma 'Carbine'. Applying principles of Fusion Powered Flamers and Advanced Gauss&PPC Technology, they have managed to create a plasma that increases in Power based on the Mech's Heat Levels. Uses Plasma Ammo. VOLATILE!

content.prevOriginal: Plasma Carbine: Increased Target Heat Generated
content.content: Plasma Carbine: цель сильнее греется

content.original: High energy residue reduces heat efficiency by 15%.
content.prevOriginal: High energy residue reduces heat efficiency by 15%.
content.content: Остатки высокой энергии снижают эффективность охлаждения на 15%.

content.original: Light ER PPC
content.prevOriginal: Light ER PPC
content.content: Light ER PPC

content.original: Coming from the same project that experimented with Capacitors on PPCs, this was an attempt to increase the effective range of the Light PPC. Achieving nearly 50% Range increase, it does suffer from a slow Charge Time and increased Minimum Range.

content.original: What started as a RISC researcher's side-project to develop faster-firing PPCs wound up looking more like a Light PPC hooked up to a pair of capacitors. This arrangement allows the weapon to fire up to twice as fast but there is a chance that the heat and charge build-up might jam up some of the shielding components. Can Toggle Between Rapid Fire or Fast Charging the Capacitor

content.original: Developed by the New Earth Trading Company in 2587, the Alacorn attracted a reputation in the SLDF as an effective and dependable tank. On this model RISC engineers have swapped out the standard trio of Gauss Rifles for dual RISC Silver Bullet Gauss Rifles and 12 tons of ammunition. Biome Restrictions: None. Movement: 3/5 hexes / 90/150 meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 400 50 Left 300 50 Right 300 50 Rear 250 50 Turret 300 50 Total 1550 250 Quirk: Improved Communications

content.original: Boss, Alacorns are one of the few tanks you will ever hear me say can reasonably stand toe to toe with a 'Mech. Their armor is incredibly thick and they are reasonably armed, a wise MechWarrior would stay weary of them.

content.original: Introduced after the Jihad, the Balac Strike VTOL was an extremely fast and versatile VTOL. RISC engineers have produced this custom variant that has seen the standard ATM launchers replaced by a pair of streak MML-5s and a vehicle stealthing system - though the effectiveness of this stealth is lessened by several wing-mounted bomb racks. Biome Restrictions: This unit can not deploy in Lunar biomes. Movement: 11/17 hexes / 330/510 meters. Armor: Vehicle Stealth Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 95 15 Left 50 15 Right 50 15 Rear 30 15 Total 240 75 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles

content.original: After the Word of Blake was defeated in the Jihad, Maxwell-Pulaski Motors modified the design slightly and produced it for the Republic of the Sphere in 3084.[9] The main differences are the removal of its Blakist features. The infantry bay was reduced to four tons, and the C3i system was replaced by a C3 slave unit. The machine gun ammunition was reduced to half a ton. All these changes increased the pod space available to the RAF Bollas by four and a half tons, but the turret can only mount fifteen tons of equipment. The Stealth Armor was retained, as was the Guardian ECM suite. Biome Restrictions: None. Movement: 5/8 hexes / 150/240 meters. Armor: Vehicle Stealth Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 180 30 Left 160 30 Right 160 30 Rear 150 30 Turret 200 30 Total 850 150 Quirk: Off Roader Omni Vehicle Can carry 1 Battle Armor Squads.

content.original: Not designed for traditional combat, the Carrier is a force multiplier. Designed to support allies from range, the Carrier can hang back behind friendly lines where it's lack of armor isn't a concern. Biome Restrictions: None. Movement: 2/3 hexes / 60/90 meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 150 40 Left 140 40 Right 140 40 Rear 100 40 Turret 100 40 Total 630 200 Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long
content.prevOriginal: Not designed for traditional combat, the Carrier is a force multiplier. content.original: A Capellan Confederation VTOL created primarily for export, the Dragoon Attack VTOL is a redesign of the Warrior series of VTOLs. Weighing 9 tons heavier, it features heavier armour then it's predecessor and a 130 rated fusion engine giving it equal speed. A Large Laser and 2 SRM-4's copy the Warrior's successful long/short range weapons pairing. Manufactured by Ceres Metals at their Indicass plant and under license by Brooks Incorporated at their Andurien plan, the Dragoon has sold poorly since it's introduction in 3047 with it's future uncertain. Biome Restrictions: This unit can not deploy in Lunar biomes. Movement: 9/14 hexes / 270/420 meters. Armor: Reflective Coating Structure: Structure Values A S Front 100 15 Left 95 15 Right 95 15 Rear 75 15 Total 380 75 Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting

content.original: The Ferret Light Scout VTOL was first introduced to House Davion troops in 2901 and later adopted by House Marik, House Steiner and certain Periphery powers. The vehicle serves as an advanced scout with the ability to monitor enemy troop movements and radio in artillery strikes. Thanks to its speed, a single Ferret can patrol a front of up to twenty kilometers long, moving quickly from one area to the next. The vehicle is lightly armored and a hit from nearly any kind of 'Mech weaponry will destroy the Ferret. However, the Ferret's job is to avoid combat, and its agility allows it to remain outside the effective range of the enemy's weapons until reinforcements arrive. Besides reconnaissance and artillery spotting, the Ferret's cargo capacity also makes it suitable for transport and rescue operations. Biome Restrictions: This unit can not deploy in Lunar biomes. Movement: 15/23 hexes / 450/690 meters. Armor: Vehicle Stealth Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 40 5 Left 10 5 Right 10 5 Rear 10 5 Total 80 25 Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile

content.original: Looking to update the J. Edgar for the modern battlefield, RISC engineers decided to augment the short-range punch with the option for long-range harassment by swapping the traditional SRMs for Multi-Missile launchers. This allows the use of LRM ammunition easily, allowing the J. Edgar to utilize its speed to dictate the range of engagement, as well as increasing the SRM missiles launched by 50% when it comes time to close in. The upgrade from a standard Medium Laser to an X-Pulse Medium laser is a modest updating of old hardware to newer specs. Biome Restrictions: None. Movement: 11/17 hexes / 330/510 meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 150 15 Left 120 15 Right 120 15 Rear 105 15 Turret 120 15 Total 615 75 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Laser

content.original: The Mantis light attack VTOL is produced by the most prolific creator of VTOLs, Michaelson Heavy Industries. Still a prototype in 3060, the Mantis is incredibly fast and capable of dealing great damage for its size. It also carries two and a half tons of armor, a significant amount for a fifteen-ton vehicle. It is also an incredibly capable scout as it carries a Beagle Active Probe and Guardian ECM Suite. Biome Restrictions: This unit can not deploy in Lunar biomes. Movement: 8/12 hexes / 240/360 meters. content.original: RISC Engineers took inspiration from the Gauss Rifle model and pushed it further, mounting a massive RISC Silver Bullet Gauss rifle in the turret. This left less room for missile weapons than many Po II variants but an MML/10 provides flexible utility. While the original Po was intended to be cheap and simple to manufacture and maintain, the modern upgrade traded the Ceres 240 internal combustion engine with a much more expensive but considerably lighter Pitban 240 XL Fusion Engine to allow a great deal increase in firepower. Eleven tons of armor, a modest increase of half a ton, provided average protection for the vehicle's weight. Biome Restrictions: None. Movement: 4/6 hexes / 120/180 meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 250 30 Left 200 30 Right 200 30 Rear 150 30 Turret 220 30 Total 1020 150 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

content.original: The Saracen is a well-designed hovercraft: it is fast and decently armored. Its weapons are designed for maximum effect against other vehicles, using a mix of long and short-range missiles mounted in its turret. It has endeared itself to its crews due to its reliability and ruggedness and forms the backbone of many striker units. The Saracen was developed towards the end of the Third Succession War by Scarborough Limited. Shortly afterward Scarborough created two other vehicles based on the Saracen, the Scimitar and the Saladin. Biome Restrictions: This unit can not deploy in Lunar or Martian biomes due to using an ICE. Movement: 8/12 hexes / 240/360 meters. Armor: Reactive Plating Structure: Structure Values A S Front 170 20 Left 125 20 Right 125 20 Rear 100 20 Turret 120 20 Total 640 100 Quirk: Rugged

content.original: Designed as an Omni vehicle, the Schiltron uses modular weapon ports similar to those used on OmniMechs allowing it to be quickly reconfigured for a variety of mission parameters. Carrying only 10 tons of armor, the Schiltron is forced to stay well out of the line of fire, something that a top speed of 54 km/h does not always make possible. The base chassis carries a C3 Computer, as well as a Guardian ECM Suite. Biome Restrictions: None. Movement: 3/5 hexes / 90/150 meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 255 40 Left 180 40 Right 180 40 Rear 125 40 Turret 225 40 Total 965 200 Quirk: Tacticon TC7000 Omni Vehicle

content.original: Designed for the original Star League after the Reunification War as a BattleMech without legs, the Von Luckner is fully capable of blasting light 'Mechs to pieces. Named after Count Felix von Luckner of twentieth century Terra, the Von Luckner is one of the few tanks to use a fusion engine, as most vehicle-mounted reactors were stripped out for use in 'Mechs during the Succession Wars. Few of these vehicles remain in service, but they are very lethal, weighing more than most 'Mechs as well as boasting heavy armor and overwhelming firepower. Biome Restrictions: None. Movement: 3/5 hexes / 90/150 meters. Armor: Reactive Plating Structure: Structure Values A S Front 275 40 Left 210 40 Right 210 40 Rear 160 40 Turret 260 40 Total 1115 200 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

content.original: RISC engineers designed this Yellow Jacket around a streak MRM launcher and experimental stealth system. Unfortunately their advances in signature-masking are mostly undone by the externally-mounted support weapons added later in testing. Biome Restrictions: This unit can not deploy in Lunar biomes. Movement: 6/9 hexes / 180/270 meters. Armor: Vehicle Stealth Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 115 15 Left 75 15 Right 75 15 Rear 60 15 Total 340 75 Quirk: Breaching Shot
content.prevOriginal: The Yellow Jacket was built around the Poland Model C Gauss rifle. Subsequent version mounted other system, but it remained centered around as single heavy weapon. Though not as fast as most VTOLs, the Yellow Jacket still has greater speed than most BattleMechs and OmniMechs. The long range weapons, respectable speed and relatively heavy armor keep the vehicle safer than many of it's peers. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 6/9 Hex: 180/270 Meters. Armor: Vehicle Stealth Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 115 15 Left 75 15 Right 75 15 Rear 60 15 Total 340 75 Quirk: Breaching Shot

content.original: In 3138 RISC Engineers produced one of the more sensible designs ever to emerge from a think tank full of eccentrics geniuses. A Fuel Cell engine and Heavy Ferrofibrous armor allowed significant upgrades to the survivability and firepower of the reliable Zhukov. In 3030, Aldis Industries deployed the successful follow up to its venerable Demolisher design, the slightly lighter Zhukov. While it shares many of the parts and features of the design that inspired it, the Zhukov is smaller, better armored, and packs less weaponry than its predecessor. Its first major deployment was with the Wolf's Dragoons whereupon the Zhukov has since seen constant improvements and tweaks as suggested to Aldis Industries by the field units that use it. The Zhukov's strength is its relative simplicity. Two turret mounted SarLon MaxiCannon Autocannon/10s are more than adequate at providing sufficient firepower for the discriminating buyer while imitating its larger cousin the Demolisher. Biome Restrictions: None. Movement: 3/5 hexes / 90/150 meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 305 40 Left 220 40 Right 220 40 Rear 175 40 Turret 235 40 Total 1155 200 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

content.original: In 3142 RISC Engineers took another look at their upgrade of the venerable Zhukov and decided it wasn't RISCy enough. Heavy RAC/5 replaced the reliable LBX/10. A Fuel Cell engine and Heavy Ferrofibrous armor allowed significant upgrades to the survivability and firepower of the reliable Zhukov. In 3030, Aldis Industries deployed the successful follow up to its venerable Demolisher design, the slightly lighter Zhukov. While it shares many of the parts and features of the design that inspired it, the Zhukov is smaller, better armored, and packs less weaponry than its predecessor. Its first major deployment was with the Wolf's Dragoons whereupon the Zhukov has since seen constant improvements and tweaks as suggested to Aldis Industries by the field units that use it. The Zhukov's strength is its relative simplicity. Two turret mounted SarLon MaxiCannon Autocannon/10s are more than adequate at providing sufficient firepower for the discriminating buyer while imitating its larger cousin the Demolisher. content.original: The Angerona Scout Suit was developed by StarCorp Industries on Terra. The suit was designed for the needs of the newly formed Republic of the Sphere's Armed Forces, with the lessons learned from Stone's Coalition during the Jihad in mind. It utilizes its stealth capacities and quick movement to scout ahead of friendly forces without being detected. Quirk: Void Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.888 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

content.original:
Designed by Fredonian Industrial Technologies, the Anubis was originally designed to compliment the Osiris BattleMech in use by the Federated Suns. The 'Mech's lightweight chassis carries a powerful Ceres Motors 250 XL engine that gives the Anubis a top speed of 129.6 km/h and is covered in a protective skin of Hellespont Lite Stealth Armor, making the Anubis extremely hard to hit at long range. This particular Anubis appears to have been a pet-project of a RISC scientist and has seen extensive upgrades to its missile systems in the form of two Artemis IV capabile RISC MML-10 launchers. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
The Anzu was well-regarded by both MechWarriors and technicians for its reliability; the AMSC found the Anzu to be a good fit for the aggressive combat tactics they had developed since the Jihad. Although the Anzu's maximum ground speed was 64 kph, the Chilton 465 Jump Jets allowed the Anzu to jump up to 120 meters. The Anzu mounted eleven tons of Starshield A Standard Armor with CASE II built in to protect the 'Mech and its pilot from ammunition explosions. The Anzu also used the same life support systems as the Shadow Hawk, already well-proven by the time the Anzu entered service, and the RCA Instatrac Mark X targeting and tracking system allowed the Anzu to simultaneously engage multiple targets while also spotting for indirect fire through the installed TAG system. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
The design of the Arctic Wolf is simple: get close, unleash a torrent of missiles, and get out. To do this, it is armed with six Type 1 SRM Six-Shooters and two Type 1 Cross-Pattern SRM-4 Launchers. Aiding the accuracy of these missiles is the Tracker Series Narc Missile Beacon. The Arctic Wolf also boasts an impressive four tons of ammunition for its launchers. The 'Mech has ten double heat sinks which can be overwhelmed, but only if a MechWarrior insists on staying in the fight or going full-tilt for long periods. The Arctic Wolf is protected by six tons of standard armor. Quirk: Advanced Optics Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

The Arctic Wolf also boasts an impressive four tons of ammunition for its launchers. The 'Mech has ten double heat sinks which can be overwhelmed, but only if a MechWarrior insists on staying in the fight or going full-tilt for long periods. The Arctic Wolf is protected by six tons of standard armor.

content.original: Continuing the trend toward specialized BattleMechs, the Bombardier was proposed to the Star League in 2735 by Wakazashi Enterprises as an "artillery 'Mech." The concept behind the design was to make a BattleMech that could replace less-mobile artillery vehicles, which might fall behind in an advance or be destroyed by counter-battery fire. It would be well-protected with twelve and a half tons of armor and use specialized missile racks which could carry diverse types of advanced missiles. Over years of testing and field exercises the Bombardier proved itself extremely effective at fulfilling the long-range fire support role, easily surpassing its vehicular counterparts and even inspiring talks of disbanding the SLDF's artillery arm once enough Bombardiers were operational. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

content.original:
The Bushwacker was originally a failed BattleMech designed to have a smaller forward profile to make the 'Mech a harder target to hit. The Bushwacker's unique design caused problems with the engine shielding, the side-effects of which manifested themselves as various gremlins in the 'Mech's on board electronics on the prototypes fielded. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower
content.prevOriginal:
The Bushwacker was originally a failed BattleMech designed to have a smaller forward profile to make the 'Mech a harder target to hit. The Bushwacker's unique design caused problems with the engine shielding, the side-effects of which manifested themselves as various gremlins in the 'Mech's on board electronics on the prototypes fielded. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower
content.content:
Изначально Bushwacker был неудачным боевым мехом, спроектированным с задумкой уменьшить передний профиль, чтобы сделать мех более сложной целью для поражения. Уникальный дизайн Bushwacker вызвал проблемы с экранированием двигателя, побочные эффекты которых проявились в виде различных сбоев в бортовой электронике у прототипов. Особенность: Узкий/низкий профиль Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.1

content.original:
Developed by the Republic Institute of Strategic Combat, the Cyclone R1 variant is the fastest production Cyclone in existence. Its massive Magna 300XL engine features an additional advanced Supercharger which allows it to outpace almost any other Light Mech. This variant eschews any EW or TAG equipment in favor of a Heavy Large Laser and a pair of Streak SRM4s. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: Two Firebees leftover from the Age of War were upgraded in 3071 when Sun-Tzu Liao revealed that he had survived the WarShip bombardment of Sian. They are protected by Stealth Armor and the requisite Guardian ECM Suite. It was designed as a swift cavalry unit capable of keeping up with lighter 'Mechs while also being able to bring the flexibility and firepower of a medium 'Mech. Based on the heavier Vapor Eagle (also known as the Goshawk), it is produced on the Inner Sphere world of Dante. The Goshawk II was designed as a second-line BattleMech for use exclusively by the Ravens.

content.original: The Inner Sphere Standard was developed following the initial thrust of the Clan invasion, as Inner Sphere powers rushed to duplicate the battle armor technology the Clans fielded. Lacking any battlefield salvage on which to base their development though, engineers were forced to work off of ancient rumors of early power armor suits like the Nighthawk, more akin to armored Exoskeletons than the 'Toads' currently rampaging through known space, and these prototypes fared poorly during testing. It took salvage from the first victories over the Clans to truly kick-start the development of battle armor. The New Avalon Institute of Science was the first to reproduce in part the Clans' Elemental armor as the Inner Sphere Standard. Quirk: Experimental Design Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.89 Can mount any unit, can melee, can swarm.

content.content: Стандарт Внутренней Сферы был разработан после вторжения Кланов, когда державы Внутренней Сферы спешили воспроизвести технологию боевой брони Кланов. Однако, не имея никаких частей с полей сражений, инженеры были вынуждены работать на основе древних слухов о ранних силовых бронекостюмах типа Nighthawk, больше похожих на бронированные экзоскелеты, чем на тех «жаб», что встречались им в настоящее время, и их прототипы плохо показывали себя во время испытаний. Настоящий толчок в изучении боевой брони дали трофеи с первых побед над Кланами. Научный институт Нового Авалона первым частично воспроизвел броню элементалей в виде Стандарта Внутренней Сферы. Особенность: Experimental Design Множитель стоимости высадки: 0.89 Может крепиться к любому юниту, может в рукопашную, может выполнять swarm.

content.original:
Designed in secret by a renegade faction within ComStar is the Kheper is a front line Medium Class BattleMech design intended to be a staple a unit within the secretly resurrected 1st Division of the Com Guard. In the aftermath of the Com Guards' destruction, the Kheper's simple construction and ease of maintenance qualities met with the needs of rebuilding the RAF. After the conflict, the New Earth-based manufacturing center would be seized by Republican forces and the production output would pour into the ranks of the Republic of the Sphere. Quirk: Advanced Optics Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

The Owens is intended to be an OmniMech upgrade of the Jenner BattleMech. The intended role for the Owens is as a cavalry 'Mech that can move along the enemy lines and designate targets for bombardment with Arrow IV artillery attacks. The Owens is a strong spotting unit as well as a point 'Mech for C3 lances with its permanently mounted TAG laser designator, Beagle Probe and C3 Slave unit. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: The first Rabid Coyote was designed as a support mech in 3066 by Clan Coyote. Perhaps because the role was undesirable to Clan warriors, in the 3100s Republic engineers discovered an untapped store of Rabid Coyotes in pristine condition, and, recognizing the value of the chassis, rebuilt them with experimental technology. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16
content.prevOriginal: The Rabid Coyote was designed by scientists from Clan Coyote to be a complement to other, slower BattleMechs. First deployed in 3066, the 'Mech was deployed in an effort to stave off the slow decline of the previous decades that had befallen the Clan that created the OmniMech. With an eye towards cost, the Rabid Coyote employs a standard fusion engine, though it does make use of an Endo Steel internal structure and eight and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor. Curiously, as the 'Mech is intended to be a bodyguard for larger 'Mechs like the Savage Coyote, front-line warriors spurn the design because they do not wish to be seen merely as ''support''. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

content.original:
From the start, the YLE-1 had a bad reputation for exploding from the smallest of hits. The Improved Gauss Rifles may have saved weight and space, but suffered from the fatal flaw of always being ready to explode, even when shut down. The Improved Heavy Medium Laser was similarly flawed, in that it could explode if damaged, but could at least be shut down to mitigate that. And, of course, the use of MRM's and their volatile ammunition; the detonation of a single volley's worth could destroy the entire side of the 'Mech. While the design team named it the YLE because it was a Prototype (Y) Limited Edition (LE) design, pilots claimed it was really 'You Like Explosions', after several spectacular failures in testing, including one where, after chasing after a captured Roadrunner for several minutes caused a catastrophic self-detonation. Still denying that the 'Mech design was at issue, engineers started to refer to the mech by the old Terran cartoon character "Wile E" instead, claiming that "only the foolish blow themselves up". This led to several fights between test pilots and engineers, as blame and consequences were constantly shifted to the other party. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: Boss, I hope you don't plan on piloting this yourself.  A round penetrates the armor, and you could see limbs fly off. I heard the designer in charge of this was in a relationship with a test pilot's sibling, and wanted to eliminate the test pilot for some inheritance scheme. It ended up wiping a whole class of test pilots, but missed the one the designer wanted.  Infuriated, the designer took the mech out for a test, hoping to crush the test pilot as they were examining a Roadrunner, and blew themselves up. So, uhh, guess the moral of the story is... don't date coworkers? Or maybe keep an eye on your heat? Don't be greedy?

content.original: The Screamer LAM is a prototype Land-Air 'Mech which was produced during the reign of Emperor Stefan Amaris when his forces were occupying the Terran Hegemony in late Star League Era. The design shares the same tonnage as the Shadow Hawk LAM. The 'Mech was built as a harasser and quick strike machine. Unlike the original prototype LAM, the Screamer was able to transition into a fighter, 'Mech, or AirMech modes.

content.original: A prototype OmniMech built on the success of the Stormcrow line, fielded by Clan Wolf for trials before going into full production. Using a combination of a 330-rated Extra-Light Fusion Engine and TSM, the 'Mech is able to achieve speeds up to 110 km/h. Perhaps the most startling innovation included in this design is the Clan Interface Armor, which allows a MechWarrior to interface with their 'Mech while being completely armored should they be forced to eject. This combination interface allows the Ryoken III pilot's a degree of control in combat, and removes the need to have a Gyro mounted in the 'Mech. This technology was thought to have been lost at the time of Skinwalker's baptism in combat by Inner Sphere powers. In addition to having its pilot encased in a power-armor interface, the Mech's hull is protected by 11.5 tons of Ferro-Lamellor Armor.

content.original:
The Stiletto was engineered in a similar vein as the Black Hawk-KU or the Rakshasa, using examples of Fire Falcon OmniMechs salvaged from the battlefield immediately following the Battle of Coventry. The Stiletto has an identical speed profile as the Fire Falcon with a VOX 280 Light Engine giving it a top speed of 129.6 km/h. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

The Templar III is a Dark Age era Assault Class OmniMech, first produced by General Motors for the Federated Suns. It was intended as a replacement for the original Templar, whose factory lines were destroyed during the Jihad. General Motors established a new production line on New Valencia for what was to become the next generation of the Templar with newer technologies. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original:
The Timber Wolf is a fast, heavy OmniMech. A signature design of the Clans' military might, it was arguably the first Clan OmniMech encountered by Inner Sphere forces on The Rock by Phelan Kell. Vaguely resembling a cross-over between the MAD (Marauder) and CAT (Catapult) series, the Timber Wolf was tagged with the Inner Sphere reporting name Mad Cat on first contact. Quirk: Experimental TC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

RISC engineers, deciding that the standard version of the Uziel just didn't shout loud enough, went to their glass drawing boards and completely reimagined the beast. Now equipped with a pair of Light PPCs in the arms, and a total of 30 launch tubes of their now (in)famous MMLs, the UZL-RX was considered to be a premier skirmisher with it's capabilities to provide hell on earth at both short and long ranges. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - Missile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
A much tougher BattleMech than its predecessor, the Viking IIC is protected by a massive 31 tons of GC Hardened Slab Armor. This is a dense and tough hardened armor, which while providing considerable protection in combat also slows the 'Mech down. Its lack of speed would make the Viking IIC unpopular with Clan warriors, who prefer swifter machines in combat. The foundation of toughness is also found in its GC Type 2C Endo Steel skeleton and a General Motors 270-Rated Fusion Engine. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.21

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: Developed by ComStar engineers just prior to the Word of Blake split, the Waukheon T74 found its way into neighboring forces in the ensuing chaos. Perhaps signifying the influences the WoB had on the project, the Waukheon T74 name comes from the Sioux language, where it is the Thunderbird, known for being enraged at the flooding of the land by Unh Cegila, and killed her with his lightning. Some rumors are abound about this design being the foundation of the WoB's Spectral LAM series, or a 'missing member', but have been unconfirmed despite heavy investigation after the liberation of Terra. Quirk: Land Air Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

content.original: A Waukheon? You just know those Wobbies had a hand in this. The T74 is a 'decapitation' design, built for high-speed high-priority-target raiding behind enemy lines. It's fielding a surprisingly heavy EWAR loadout, including a custom Stealth armor that worked with the transformation mechanism (though rumors abound about the right leg's stealth armor being of poorer quality, to the point of not existing, despite being identical to the left leg's). The weaponry equipped is niche, as to be expected: MML's with Acid ammo, and MG arrays with AP ammo; perfect for melting the armor off of command vehicles behind enemy lines.

content.prevOriginal: The primary objective to destroy the garrison / defenders of the base.
content.content: Основная задача - уничтожить гарнизон/защитников базы.

content.original: HIDDEN Objective: Destroy Base Turrets
content.prevOriginal: HIDDEN Objective: Destroy Base Turrets
content.content: HIDDEN Objective: уничтожить турели базы

content.original: The objective to eliminate enemy reinforcements who attack.
content.prevOriginal: The objective to eliminate enemy reinforcements who attack.
content.content: Задача - устранить атакующие подкрепления противника.

content.original: The objective for the player to extract their units.
content.prevOriginal: The objective for the player to extract their units.
content.content: Задача игрока - вывести свои юниты.

content.original: Welcome to my play area, Commander!
content.prevOriginal: Welcome to my play area, Commander!
content.content: Добро пожаловать на мою игровую арену, командир!

content.original: You will find this base is Quiet Operational.
content.prevOriginal: You will find this base is Quiet Operational.
content.content: Вы найдете эту базу вполне работоспособной.

content.original: I always wanted to say that!
content.prevOriginal: I always wanted to say that!
content.content: Всегда хотелось это сказать!

content.original: Thank you commander We appreciate your work.
content.prevOriginal: Thank you commander We appreciate your work.
content.content: Спасибо командир Мы ценим вашу работу.

content.original: Feel Free to take what you want.
content.prevOriginal: Feel Free to take what you want.
content.content: Не стесняйтесь, берите, что хотите.

content.original: Tell LA I win this bet as well.
content.prevOriginal: Tell LA I win this bet as well.
content.content: Передайте LA, что я выиграл и это пари.

content.original: What if I told you I had two Level IIs at my disposal!
content.prevOriginal: What if I told you I had two Level IIs at my disposal!
content.content: А что, если я скажу, что у меня было два Level II в распоряжении!

content.original: We've demolished the objective buildings. No need to loiter, get to the evac zone.
content.prevOriginal: We've demolished the objective buildings. No need to loiter, get to the evac zone.
content.content: Мы разнесли отмеченные строения. Не стоит мешкать, отправляйтесь в зону эвакуации.

content.original: Good shots, Commander! You scored a solid hit on one of the target structures, keep it up.
content.prevOriginal: Good shots, Commander! You scored a solid hit on one of the target structures, keep it up.
content.content: Хорошая стрельба, командир! Минус одно здание. Продолжайте в том же духе.

content.original: Target building destroyed, good work commander, stay at it and we'll be done in no time.
content.prevOriginal: Target building destroyed, good work commander, stay at it and we'll be done in no time.
content.content: Целевое здание уничтожено, хорошая работа командир. Продолжайте в том же духе и мы быстро закончим.

content.original: Bkt_KillConfirmed: The garrison is destroyed. Good Work.
content.prevOriginal: Bkt_KillConfirmed: The garrison is destroyed. Good Work.
content.content: Bkt_KillConfirmed: гарнизон уничтожен. Хорошая работа.

content.original: Developed by the New Earth Trading Company in 2587, the Alacorn attracted a reputation in the SLDF as an effective and dependable tank. On this model RISC engineers have swapped out the standard trio of Gauss Rifles for dual RISC Silver Bullet Gauss Rifles and 12 tons of ammunition. Biome Restrictions: None. Movement: 3/5 hexes / 90/150 meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 400 50 Left 300 50 Right 300 50 Rear 250 50 Turret 300 50 Total 1550 250 Quirk: Improved Communications

content.original: Introduced after the Jihad, the Balac Strike VTOL was an extremely fast and versatile VTOL. RISC engineers have produced this custom variant that has seen the standard ATM launchers replaced by a pair of streak MML-5s and a vehicle stealthing system - though the effectiveness of this stealth is lessened by several wing-mounted bomb racks. Biome Restrictions: This unit can not deploy in Lunar biomes. Movement: 11/17 hexes / 330/510 meters. Armor: Vehicle Stealth Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 95 15 Left 50 15 Right 50 15 Rear 30 15 Total 240 75 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles

content.original: After the Word of Blake was defeated in the Jihad, Maxwell-Pulaski Motors modified the design slightly and produced it for the Republic of the Sphere in 3084.[9] The main differences are the removal of its Blakist features. The infantry bay was reduced to four tons, and the C3i system was replaced by a C3 slave unit. The machine gun ammunition was reduced to half a ton. All these changes increased the pod space available to the RAF Bollas by four and a half tons, but the turret can only mount fifteen tons of equipment. The Stealth Armor was retained, as was the Guardian ECM suite. Biome Restrictions: None. Movement: 5/8 hexes / 150/240 meters. Armor: Vehicle Stealth Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 180 30 Left 160 30 Right 160 30 Rear 150 30 Turret 200 30 Total 850 150 Quirk: Off Roader Omni Vehicle Can carry 1 Battle Armor Squads.

content.original: A monster of a unit, these heavily armed VTOLs are the epitome of the Gunship. Line breakers and fire support platforms, these are usually found in the front of an attack. Carrying an array of ranged weapons, the Assault VTOL is designed to smash targets at range. Biome Restrictions: This unit can not deploy in Lunar biomes. Movement: 6/9 hexes / 180/270 meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 240 30 Left 180 30 Right 180 30 Rear 150 30 Total 775 150 Quirk: Integrated Searchlight
content.prevOriginal: A monster of a unit, these heavily armed VTOL's are the epitome of the Gunship. Line breakers and fire support platforms, these are usually found in the front of an attack. content.content: Эти тяжеловооруженные VTOL являются воплощением боевого корабля. Прорыватели линий и платформы огневой поддержки, они обычно находятся на переднем крае атаки. Штурмовой VTOL, несущий на борту целый комплекс стрелкового оружия, предназначен для поражения целей на расстоянии. Ограничения биома: этот юнит не может действовать в лунных биомах. Передвижение: 6/9 hexes / 180/270 meters. Броня: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Структура: Structure Знач-я Б С Перед 240 30 Лево 180 30 Право 180 30 Зад 150 30 Итого 775 150 Особенность: Встроенный прожектор

content.original: A Capellan Confederation VTOL created primarily for export, the Dragoon Attack VTOL is a redesign of the Warrior series of VTOLs. Weighing 9 tons heavier, it features heavier armour then it's predecessor and a 130 rated fusion engine giving it equal speed. A Large Laser and 2 SRM-4's copy the Warrior's successful long/short range weapons pairing. Manufactured by Ceres Metals at their Indicass plant and under license by Brooks Incorporated at their Andurien plan, the Dragoon has sold poorly since it's introduction in 3047 with it's future uncertain. Biome Restrictions: This unit can not deploy in Lunar biomes. Movement: 9/14 hexes / 270/420 meters. Armor: Reflective Coating Structure: Structure Values A S Front 100 15 Left 95 15 Right 95 15 Rear 75 15 Total 380 75 Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting

Weighing 9 tons heavier, it features heavier armour then it's predecessor and a 130 rated fusion engine giving it equal speed. A Large Laser and 2 SRM-4's copy the Warrior's successful long/short range weapons pairing. Manufactured by Ceres Metals at their Indicass plant and under license by Brooks Incorporated at their Andurien plan, the Dragoon has sold poorly since it's introduction in 3047 with it's future uncertain. Ограничения биома: этот юнит не может действовать в лунных биомах. Передвижение: 9/14 hexes / 270/420 meters. content.original: The Ferret Light Scout VTOL was first introduced to House Davion troops in 2901 and later adopted by House Marik, House Steiner and certain Periphery powers. The vehicle serves as an advanced scout with the ability to monitor enemy troop movements and radio in artillery strikes. Thanks to its speed, a single Ferret can patrol a front of up to twenty kilometers long, moving quickly from one area to the next. The vehicle is lightly armored and a hit from nearly any kind of 'Mech weaponry will destroy the Ferret. However, the Ferret's job is to avoid combat, and its agility allows it to remain outside the effective range of the enemy's weapons until reinforcements arrive. Besides reconnaissance and artillery spotting, the Ferret's cargo capacity also makes it suitable for transport and rescue operations. Biome Restrictions: This unit can not deploy in Lunar biomes. Movement: 15/23 hexes / 450/690 meters. Armor: Vehicle Stealth Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 40 5 Left 10 5 Right 10 5 Rear 10 5 Total 80 25 Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile

content.original: Looking to update the J. Edgar for the modern battlefield, RISC engineers decided to augment the short-range punch with the option for long-range harassment by swapping the traditional SRMs for Multi-Missile launchers. This allows the use of LRM ammunition easily, allowing the J. Edgar to utilize its speed to dictate the range of engagement, as well as increasing the SRM missiles launched by 50% when it comes time to close in. The upgrade from a standard Medium Laser to an X-Pulse Medium laser is a modest updating of old hardware to newer specs. Biome Restrictions: None. Movement: 11/17 hexes / 330/510 meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 150 15 Left 120 15 Right 120 15 Rear 105 15 Turret 120 15 Total 615 75 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Laser

content.original: The Mantis light attack VTOL is produced by the most prolific creator of VTOLs, Michaelson Heavy Industries. Still a prototype in 3060, the Mantis is incredibly fast and capable of dealing great damage for its size. It also carries two and a half tons of armor, a significant amount for a fifteen-ton vehicle. It is also an incredibly capable scout as it carries a Beagle Active Probe and Guardian ECM Suite. Biome Restrictions: This unit can not deploy in Lunar biomes. Movement: 8/12 hexes / 240/360 meters. content.original: RISC Engineers took inspiration from the Gauss Rifle model and pushed it further, mounting a massive RISC Silver Bullet Gauss rifle in the turret. This left less room for missile weapons than many Po II variants but an MML/10 provides flexible utility. While the original Po was intended to be cheap and simple to manufacture and maintain, the modern upgrade traded the Ceres 240 internal combustion engine with a much more expensive but considerably lighter Pitban 240 XL Fusion Engine to allow a great deal increase in firepower. Eleven tons of armor, a modest increase of half a ton, provided average protection for the vehicle's weight. Biome Restrictions: None. Movement: 4/6 hexes / 120/180 meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 250 30 Left 200 30 Right 200 30 Rear 150 30 Turret 220 30 Total 1020 150 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

content.original: The Saracen is a well-designed hovercraft: it is fast and decently armored. Its weapons are designed for maximum effect against other vehicles, using a mix of long and short-range missiles mounted in its turret. It has endeared itself to its crews due to its reliability and ruggedness and forms the backbone of many striker units. The Saracen was developed towards the end of the Third Succession War by Scarborough Limited. Shortly afterward Scarborough created two other vehicles based on the Saracen, the Scimitar and the Saladin. Biome Restrictions: This unit can not deploy in Lunar or Martian biomes due to using an ICE. Movement: 8/12 hexes / 240/360 meters. Armor: Reactive Plating Structure: Structure Values A S Front 170 20 Left 125 20 Right 125 20 Rear 100 20 Turret 120 20 Total 640 100 Quirk: Rugged

content.original: Designed as an Omni vehicle, the Schiltron uses modular weapon ports similar to those used on OmniMechs allowing it to be quickly reconfigured for a variety of mission parameters. Carrying only 10 tons of armor, the Schiltron is forced to stay well out of the line of fire, something that a top speed of 54 km/h does not always make possible. The base chassis carries a C3 Computer, as well as a Guardian ECM Suite. Biome Restrictions: None. Movement: 3/5 hexes / 90/150 meters. content.original: The Republic's take on the Seth Stealth Assault Bomber places substantially more weight on the "Bomber" feature, than on the "Stealth" feature. The massive externally-carried warhead renders the design rather less subtle than contemporary bombers, and the design was largely considered a failure despite several successful operations. content.original: Designed for the original Star League after the Reunification War as a BattleMech without legs, the Von Luckner is fully capable of blasting light 'Mechs to pieces. Named after Count Felix von Luckner of twentieth century Terra, the Von Luckner is one of the few tanks to use a fusion engine, as most vehicle-mounted reactors were stripped out for use in 'Mechs during the Succession Wars. Few of these vehicles remain in service, but they are very lethal, weighing more than most 'Mechs as well as boasting heavy armor and overwhelming firepower. Biome Restrictions: None. Movement: 3/5 hexes / 90/150 meters. Armor: Reactive Plating Structure: Structure Values A S Front 275 40 Left 210 40 Right 210 40 Rear 160 40 Turret 260 40 Total 1115 200 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

Though not as fast as most VTOLs, the Yellow Jacket still has greater speed than most BattleMechs and OmniMechs. The long range weapons, respectable speed and relatively heavy armor keep the vehicle safer than many of it's peers. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. content.original: In 3138 RISC Engineers produced one of the more sensible designs ever to emerge from a think tank full of eccentrics geniuses. A Fuel Cell engine and Heavy Ferrofibrous armor allowed significant upgrades to the survivability and firepower of the reliable Zhukov. In 3030, Aldis Industries deployed the successful follow up to its venerable Demolisher design, the slightly lighter Zhukov. While it shares many of the parts and features of the design that inspired it, the Zhukov is smaller, better armored, and packs less weaponry than its predecessor. Its first major deployment was with the Wolf's Dragoons whereupon the Zhukov has since seen constant improvements and tweaks as suggested to Aldis Industries by the field units that use it. The Zhukov's strength is its relative simplicity. Two turret mounted SarLon MaxiCannon Autocannon/10s are more than adequate at providing sufficient firepower for the discriminating buyer while imitating its larger cousin the Demolisher. Biome Restrictions: None. Movement: 3/5 hexes / 90/150 meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 305 40 Left 220 40 Right 220 40 Rear 175 40 Turret 235 40 Total 1155 200 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

В отличие от прочих танков Слова Блейка, этот не имеет DNI, несмотря на передовую электронику. Ограничения биома: нет. Передвижение: 7/11 hexes / 210/330 meters. Броня: Vehicle Adv. Stealth Структура: Vehicle Composite Знач-я Б С Перед 220 70 Лево 200 70 Право 200 70 Зад 150 70 Турель 200 70 Итого 970 350 Особенность: Основной боевой танк Омни-техника

content.original: The Angerona Scout Suit was developed by StarCorp Industries on Terra. The suit was designed for the needs of the newly formed Republic of the Sphere's Armed Forces, with the lessons learned from Stone's Coalition during the Jihad in mind. It utilizes its stealth capacities and quick movement to scout ahead of friendly forces without being detected. Quirk: Void Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.888 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

content.original:
Designed by Fredonian Industrial Technologies, the Anubis was originally designed to compliment the Osiris BattleMech in use by the Federated Suns. The 'Mech's lightweight chassis carries a powerful Ceres Motors 250 XL engine that gives the Anubis a top speed of 129.6 km/h and is covered in a protective skin of Hellespont Lite Stealth Armor, making the Anubis extremely hard to hit at long range. This particular Anubis appears to have been a pet-project of a RISC scientist and has seen extensive upgrades to its missile systems in the form of two Artemis IV capabile RISC MML-10 launchers. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
The Anzu was well-regarded by both MechWarriors and technicians for its reliability; the AMSC found the Anzu to be a good fit for the aggressive combat tactics they had developed since the Jihad. Although the Anzu's maximum ground speed was 64 kph, the Chilton 465 Jump Jets allowed the Anzu to jump up to 120 meters. The Anzu mounted eleven tons of Starshield A Standard Armor with CASE II built in to protect the 'Mech and its pilot from ammunition explosions. The Anzu also used the same life support systems as the Shadow Hawk, already well-proven by the time the Anzu entered service, and the RCA Instatrac Mark X targeting and tracking system allowed the Anzu to simultaneously engage multiple targets while also spotting for indirect fire through the installed TAG system. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

After the Liberation of Terra many Celestials have been captured by Republic Forces, using them as Testbed for advanced design for their Future Forces was this Archangel Recreated, sacrificing Omni Capabilities for Advanced Defenses and replacing the Blade for a Large Vibro Blade. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.23

content.original:
The design of the Arctic Wolf is simple: get close, unleash a torrent of missiles, and get out. To do this, it is armed with six Type 1 SRM Six-Shooters and two Type 1 Cross-Pattern SRM-4 Launchers. Aiding the accuracy of these missiles is the Tracker Series Narc Missile Beacon. The Arctic Wolf also boasts an impressive four tons of ammunition for its launchers. The 'Mech has ten double heat sinks which can be overwhelmed, but only if a MechWarrior insists on staying in the fight or going full-tilt for long periods. The Arctic Wolf is protected by six tons of standard armor. Quirk: Advanced Optics Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: Continuing the trend toward specialized BattleMechs, the Bombardier was proposed to the Star League in 2735 by Wakazashi Enterprises as an "artillery 'Mech." The concept behind the design was to make a BattleMech that could replace less-mobile artillery vehicles, which might fall behind in an advance or be destroyed by counter-battery fire. It would be well-protected with twelve and a half tons of armor and use specialized missile racks which could carry diverse types of advanced missiles. Over years of testing and field exercises the Bombardier proved itself extremely effective at fulfilling the long-range fire support role, easily surpassing its vehicular counterparts and even inspiring talks of disbanding the SLDF's artillery arm once enough Bombardiers were operational. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

content.original:
The Bushwacker was originally a failed BattleMech designed to have a smaller forward profile to make the 'Mech a harder target to hit. The Bushwacker's unique design caused problems with the engine shielding, the side-effects of which manifested themselves as various gremlins in the 'Mech's on board electronics on the prototypes fielded. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.content:
Изначально Bushwacker был неудачным боевым мехом, спроектированным с задумкой уменьшить передний профиль, чтобы сделать мех более сложной целью для поражения. Уникальный дизайн Bushwacker вызвал проблемы с экранированием двигателя, побочные эффекты которых проявились в виде различных сбоев в бортовой электронике у прототипов. Особенность: Узкий/низкий профиль Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.1

content.original: The Inner Sphere Standard was developed following the initial thrust of the Clan invasion, as Inner Sphere powers rushed to duplicate the battle armor technology the Clans fielded. Lacking any battlefield salvage on which to base their development though, engineers were forced to work off of ancient rumors of early power armor suits like the Nighthawk, more akin to armored Exoskeletons than the 'Toads' currently rampaging through known space, and these prototypes fared poorly during testing. It took salvage from the first victories over the Clans to truly kick-start the development of battle armor. The New Avalon Institute of Science was the first to reproduce in part the Clans' Elemental armor as the Inner Sphere Standard. Quirk: Experimental Design Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.89 Can mount any unit, can melee, can swarm.

content.content: Стандарт Внутренней Сферы был разработан после вторжения Кланов, когда державы Внутренней Сферы спешили воспроизвести технологию боевой брони Кланов. Однако, не имея никаких частей с полей сражений, инженеры были вынуждены работать на основе древних слухов о ранних силовых бронекостюмах типа Nighthawk, больше похожих на бронированные экзоскелеты, чем на тех «жаб», что встречались им в настоящее время, и их прототипы плохо показывали себя во время испытаний. Настоящий толчок в изучении боевой брони дали трофеи с первых побед над Кланами. Научный институт Нового Авалона первым частично воспроизвел броню элементалей в виде Стандарта Внутренней Сферы. Особенность: Experimental Design Множитель стоимости высадки: 0.89 Может крепиться к любому юниту, может в рукопашную, может выполнять swarm.

content.original:
Designed in secret by a renegade faction within ComStar is the Kheper is a front line Medium Class BattleMech design intended to be a staple a unit within the secretly resurrected 1st Division of the Com Guard. In the aftermath of the Com Guards' destruction, the Kheper's simple construction and ease of maintenance qualities met with the needs of rebuilding the RAF. After the conflict, the New Earth-based manufacturing center would be seized by Republican forces and the production output would pour into the ranks of the Republic of the Sphere. Quirk: Advanced Optics Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: The first Rabid Coyote was designed as a support mech in 3066 by Clan Coyote. Perhaps because the role was undesirable to Clan warriors, in the 3100s Republic engineers discovered an untapped store of Rabid Coyotes in pristine condition, and, recognizing the value of the chassis, rebuilt them with experimental technology. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16
content.prevOriginal: The Rabid Coyote was designed by scientists from Clan Coyote to be a complement to other, slower BattleMechs. First deployed in 3066, the 'Mech was deployed in an effort to stave off the slow decline of the previous decades that had befallen the Clan that created the OmniMech. With an eye towards cost, the Rabid Coyote employs a standard fusion engine, though it does make use of an Endo Steel internal structure and eight and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor. Curiously, as the 'Mech is intended to be a bodyguard for larger 'Mechs like the Savage Coyote, front-line warriors spurn the design because they do not wish to be seen merely as ''support''. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

content.original:
From the start, the YLE-1 had a bad reputation for exploding from the smallest of hits. The Improved Gauss Rifles may have saved weight and space, but suffered from the fatal flaw of always being ready to explode, even when shut down. The Improved Heavy Medium Laser was similarly flawed, in that it could explode if damaged, but could at least be shut down to mitigate that. And, of course, the use of MRM's and their volatile ammunition; the detonation of a single volley's worth could destroy the entire side of the 'Mech. While the design team named it the YLE because it was a Prototype (Y) Limited Edition (LE) design, pilots claimed it was really 'You Like Explosions', after several spectacular failures in testing, including one where, after chasing after a captured Roadrunner for several minutes caused a catastrophic self-detonation. Still denying that the 'Mech design was at issue, engineers started to refer to the mech by the old Terran cartoon character "Wile E" instead, claiming that "only the foolish blow themselves up". This led to several fights between test pilots and engineers, as blame and consequences were constantly shifted to the other party. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
A much tougher BattleMech than its predecessor, the Viking IIC is protected by a massive 31 tons of GC Hardened Slab Armor. This is a dense and tough hardened armor, which while providing considerable protection in combat also slows the 'Mech down. Its lack of speed would make the Viking IIC unpopular with Clan warriors, who prefer swifter machines in combat. The foundation of toughness is also found in its GC Type 2C Endo Steel skeleton and a General Motors 270-Rated Fusion Engine. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.21

content.original: Developed by ComStar engineers just prior to the Word of Blake split, the Waukheon T74 found its way into neighboring forces in the ensuing chaos. Perhaps signifying the influences the WoB had on the project, the Waukheon T74 name comes from the Sioux language, where it is the Thunderbird, known for being enraged at the flooding of the land by Unh Cegila, and killed her with his lightning. Some rumors are abound about this design being the foundation of the WoB's Spectral LAM series, or a 'missing member', but have been unconfirmed despite heavy investigation after the liberation of Terra. Quirk: Land Air Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

content.original:
Originally developed in the final year of the Amaris Civil War as the ultimate fixed position city defense BattleMech, the Annihilator was built as a sign of the military strength of the Star League in Exile. The -1A was armed with four Autocannon/10s and four Medium Lasers. While less accurate than the original -2A, the 1A was still a highly destructive and dangerous 'Mech that no MechWarrior looked forward to engaging. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.29

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: Introduced after the Jihad, the Balac Strike VTOL was an extremely fast and versatile VTOL. RISC engineers have produced this custom variant that has seen the standard ATM launchers replaced by a pair of streak MML-5s and a vehicle stealthing system. Biome Restrictions: This unit can not deploy in Lunar biomes. Movement: 11/17 hexes / 330/510 meters. Armor: Vehicle Stealth Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 95 15 Left 50 15 Right 50 15 Rear 30 15 Total 240 75 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles

content.original: The Angerona Scout Suit was developed by StarCorp Industries on Terra. The suit was designed for the needs of the newly formed Republic of the Sphere's Armed Forces, with the lessons learned from Stone's Coalition during the Jihad in mind. It utilizes its stealth capacities and quick movement to scout ahead of friendly forces without being detected. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.888 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

content.original: The Screamer LAM is a prototype Land-Air 'Mech which was produced during the reign of Emperor Stefan Amaris when his forces were occupying the Terran Hegemony in late Star League Era. The design shares the same tonnage as the Shadow Hawk LAM. The 'Mech was built as a harasser and quick strike machine. Unlike the original prototype LAM, the Screamer was able to transition into a fighter, 'Mech, or AirMech modes.

content.original: A prototype OmniMech built on the success of the Stormcrow line, fielded by Clan Wolf for trials before going into full production. Using a combination of a 330-rated Extra-Light Fusion Engine and TSM, the 'Mech is able to achieve speeds up to 110 km/h. Perhaps the most startling innovation included in this design is the Clan Interface Armor, which allows a MechWarrior to interface with their 'Mech while being completely armored should they be forced to eject. This combination interface allows the Ryoken III pilot's a degree of control in combat, and removes the need to have a Gyro mounted in the 'Mech. This technology was thought to have been lost at the time of Skinwalker's baptism in combat by Inner Sphere powers. In addition to having its pilot encased in a power-armor interface, the Mech's hull is protected by 11.5 tons of Ferro-Lamellor Armor.
content.prevOriginal: A prototype OmniMech built on the success of the Stormcrow line, fielded by Clan Wolf for trials before going into full production. Using a combination of a 330-rated Extra-Light Fusion Engine and TSM, the 'Mech is able to achieve speeds up to 110 km/h. Perhaps the most startling innovation included in this design is the Clan Interface Armor, which allows a MechWarrior to interface with their 'Mech while being completely armored should they be forced to eject. This combination interface allows the Ryoken III pilot's a degree of control in combat, and removes the need to have a Gyro mounted in the 'Mech. This technology was thought to have been lost at the time of Skinwalker's baptism in combat by Inner Sphere powers. In addition to having its pilot encased in a power-armor interface, the Mech's hull is protected by 11.5 tons of Ferro-Lamellor Armor.

content.original: Introduced after the Jihad, the Balac Strike VTOL was an extremely fast and versatile VTOL. RISC engineers have produced this custom variant that has seen the standard ATM launchers replaced by a pair of streak MML-5s and a vehicle stealthing system. Biome Restrictions: This unit can not deploy in Lunar biomes. Movement: 11/17 hexes / 330/510 meters. Armor: Vehicle Stealth Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 95 15 Left 50 15 Right 50 15 Rear 30 15 Total 240 75 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles

content.original: The Angerona Scout Suit was developed by StarCorp Industries on Terra. The suit was designed for the needs of the newly formed Republic of the Sphere's Armed Forces, with the lessons learned from Stone's Coalition during the Jihad in mind. It utilizes its stealth capacities and quick movement to scout ahead of friendly forces without being detected. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.888 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

content.original:
The A loadout trades the Small Supra Lasers and one of the iATM-12 launchers of the primary configuration to instead add a Large Supra Laser and two Small ER Pulse Lasers. Even with a total of 18 heat sinks, the heat buildup is slightly more than the cooling unlike the primary configuration. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.37

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni
