content.original: Ranged Superheavy
content.prevOriginal: Ranged Superheavy
content.content: Дальнобойный сверхтяж

content.original: After finishing the development of the Osteon, the Society moved into superheavy territory with the 150 ton Keratos. A 420 XL engine core provides the 'Mech's power, and a radical double heat sink kit is used as the cooling system. Still focused on ranged attack, mostly through ATM launchers, it shares many of the traits of the original Osteon. The Keratos is the first Society developed 'Mech that uses the new Superheavy CLPS, which operates at a slightly lower capacity than the standard version due to the difference in frame size of superheavies.

content.original:
The D loadout moves the center torso iATM-12 launcher to one of the side torsos and mounts an extra iATM-12 launcher in the other side torso, but removes all other weapons. The fifteen heat sinks, two of them external for some reason, will struggle to keep up with the generated heat, meaning repeated alpha strikes are not recommended. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.37

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: A Society take on the Nanook, this 'Mech carries a Large and Medium Supra Laser in each arm, all with the addition of a Laser Insulator, thus utilizing the laser enabling traits of the basic chassis design to its fullest. In the side torsos a Heavy Gauss Rifle and an iATM-9 launcher reside, allowing both indirect and long range damage. The design further uses the Society developed Chameleon Light Polarizing Shield stealth system to hide its presence before it is able to engage its foes. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - Laser Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.44

content.original: When Clan Ghost Bear needed a superheavy 'Mech, they took the basic Kodiak concepts and created the Nanook. A 160 ton beast of a 'Mech, fully armored and surprisingly fast thanks to its 460 XXL engine, it is meant to out-manuever other superheavies before dealing a full on alpha strike. Worth noticing is that the way the internal circuitry of the Nanook is set up, it heavily favours Laser weapons.

The D loadout moves the center torso iATM-12 launcher to one of the side torsos and mounts an extra iATM-12 launcher in the other side torso, but removes all other weapons. The fifteen heat sinks, two of them external for some reason, will struggle to keep up with the generated heat, meaning repeated alpha strikes are not recommended. content.original: Once the news of the new Arachnid design reached the Society, they could of course not let some upstarts in the Inner Sphere beat them in 'Mech development and therefore started a refitting project. The first result was the Z version, mounting three Large Supra Lasers, two Hyper Velocity AC/20 and two Large ER Pulse lasers, and the Superheavy variant of the Torso mounted Cockpit. The design struggles with heat buildup from its weapons, but this is not unusual for the Society's designs and just something any piloting MechWarrior will have to adapt to. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.47

content.original: Juggernaut
content.prevOriginal: Juggernaut
content.content: Джаггернаут

content.original: The lack of a Clan-made Superheavy QuadMech irked some of the more progressive scientists from the clans that had made it back to the Inner Sphere. So they decided to collaborate in secret on Project Colossus, meant to be the pinnacle of Clan design and ingenuity. The resulting 200 ton Quad OmniMech was eventually renamed to the Arachnid, and was more an ode to the decadence and delusion of grandeur that has started to seep into the Inner Sphere clans than fulfilling any practical role.

The resulting 200 ton Quad OmniMech was eventually renamed to the Arachnid, and was more an ode to the decadence and delusion of grandeur that has started to seep into the Inner Sphere clans than fulfilling any practical role.

content.original: Since the modifications of the Z design focused on showcasing the Society's weapon designs rather than actually being useful, the result wasn't very different from the already existing loadouts once out on the battlefield. To prove once and for all that they were the better 'Mech designers, the Society then came up with the highly experimental Arachnid ZX variant, using all their fanciest technology. Two Arrow V launchers, two Heavy Gauss Rifles and a center torso mounted Light Ultra Gauss Rifle all combine to create a quite capable long range weapons profile. The combination of the Society specific Ferro-Carbide Shell armor and Endo-Titanium structure together with the brand new and still experimental Improved Superheavy Torso Cockpit really showcases the R&D capabilities of the Society, but the lack of any close range weapons besides a single ER Large Laser meant that even the ZX fails to fully impress on the battlefield. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.49

content.original:
The Arctos ACT-1 has a clear long range damage profile with its two Heavy Gauss Rifles and iATM-9 launchers. It does still mount a combination of Medium ER Pulse Lasers and Medium Supra Lasers for closer engagements, but the variant suffers at close range battles. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.45

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: Society Superheavy
content.prevOriginal: Society Superheavy
content.content: Сверхтяж от Общества

content.original: The Arctos is a pure Society design based on the Minsk, and as such is carrying a lot of experimental and cutting edge technology that is still not generally available. Through the use of Ferro-Carbide Shell armor and Endo Titanium structure enough weight is saved to enable the Arctos to both be heavily armored and still mount a considerable weaponry with a large damage potential - it even still is somewhat mobile for a superheavy thanks to its large XL engine. To remaining noticeable features includes an Advanced Torso Cockpit, a head mounted Advanced Laser AMS and prototype double heat sinks.

content.original:
The Arctos ACT-2 uses a combination of the recently created Society MRM-60 launchers and optimized Heavy Gauss Rifles to give a more balanced damage profile than the ACT-1. The major downside of the variant is the fact that all its weaponry is ammunition dependant, making it not ideal for long engagements. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.45

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

The major downside of the variant is the fact that all its weaponry is ammunition dependant, making it not ideal for long engagements. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.45

content.original: The Arctos is a pure Society design based on the Minsk, and as such is carrying a lot of experimental and cutting edge technology that is still not generally available. Through the use of Ferro-Carbide Shell armor and Endo Titanium structure enough weight is saved to enable the Arctos to both be heavily armored and still mount a considerable weaponry with a large damage potential - it even still is somewhat mobile for a superheavy thanks to its large XL engine. To remaining noticeable features includes an Advanced Torso Cockpit, a head mounted Advanced Laser AMS and prototype double heat sinks.

content.original:
Just like the ACT-1 and -2, the ACT-3 uses Heavy Gauss Rifles as its base weapons, together with two Hyper Velocity Autocannon 10. Since these weapons are not adequate for short range defense, two Medium ER Pulse Lasers were added for secondary fire capabilities. The final set of weapons are two Tesla Rifles, allowing the 'Mech to disrupt any enemy forces' internal systems. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.45

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
The Arctos ACT-5 carries a full on iATM setup. The four launchers with 12 tubes each means a total of 48 missiles can be fired at any enemy with great precision. The only Arctos with Boost Jets allowing it to jump and a larger engine, its mobility allows it to reposition easily for the next missile salvo, flanking slower superheavies with ease. A single head-mounted Snubnose PPC provides some non-ammunition dependent backup firepower. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.45

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: The Doom Turtle is an attempt at creating a mobile fortress out of a superheavy QuadMech. Designed by the brilliant but sometimes over-creative minds of the Society, it is the true pinnacle of what you can do with a QuadMech. Using a specifically designed custom Ferro-Carbide Lammellor armor ensures the Quad can take anything short of a direct nuclear hit and just shake it off. Packed with the latest weapon technologies from the Society, the Doom Turtle brings twin Heavy Gauss Rifles and MRM-60 launchers, a Small Supra Laser and a Snubnose PPC. Quirk: Superheavy Prototype Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.6

content.original: After finishing the development of the Osteon, the Society moved into superheavy territory with the 150 ton Keratos. A 420 XL engine core provides the 'Mech's power, and a radical double heat sink kit is used as the cooling system. Still focused on ranged attack, mostly through ATM launchers, it shares many of the traits of the original Osteon. The Keratos is the first Society developed 'Mech that uses the new Superheavy CLPS, which operates at a slightly lower capacity than the standard version due to the difference in frame size of superheavies.

content.original:
The ninth and final configuration of the Leliourium, named after the original demon king 'Belial', is also the most controversial. Replacing a lot of the technology with acquired clan versions - mainly from the Society's laboratories - leads to some Demi-Precentors feeling it is a blasphemy to use such a Mech. But when it comes to the actual battle, the Domini will pilot it like any other 'Mech; using it to bring the word of Blake to the rest of the galaxy. Quirk: Wrath of Blake Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.47

content.original: When the news of Precentor Vapula's Celestial series of 'Mechs reached Precentor Destral VII, he refused to have his devotion be outdone. Throwing all available, and unavailable, resources at the task, Precentor Destral VII's design team created the Leliorium, a 200t Omnimech, named after the highest rank of demons in the Ars Goetia, as compared to the Celestial series' angels. Furthering the point that these are not just the Celestials on steroids, each configuration is further named after one of the nine demon kings.  Each one brings to bear the cutting edge of experimental weaponry and armor, such as the Exsecratio Stealth Armor and the Seraphim Electronic Warfare Suite. The final check, before each unit is released from the factory, is a holy blessing by 6 high Blakist Priests, ensuring that the pilot, and 'Mech, are well taken care of by Blake.

content.original: The Ophanim was created by the Word of Blake to become the keystone of their blessed military forces. Weighting in at 150t and utilizing a 425-rated core, the Ophanim brings Divine Wrath in its arms, and the Blessed Rains in the side torsos.  Those hoping that great weight given to the weaponry has cost it armor protection, will find that the Spirit of Blake has been blessed on this Sanctus Armor, helping to lift the load from those going to preach the Truth under fire.  Included as well, is a Blessed Gyro, and Seraphim EWAR Suite, both given blessings by the highest priests of the order, which has had some positive effects on combat performance. And to drive home the point that this is a model just for those who truly believe, it requires the pilot to have undergone significant cyberfication, to the point of almost embedding them into the cockpit.

content.original: The Tercio is the Escorpión_Imperio's flagship BattleMech. The 185 ton behemoth is focused on massive firepower and supporting it with advanced technology to maximize its efficiency. Although constructed only in limited numbers, the Tercio has quickly gained a reputation of being able to overwhelm even the most reinforced of positions.

content.original: Extreme Chassis Cooling System
content.prevOriginal: Extreme Chassis Cooling System
content.content: Extreme Chassis Cooling System

content.original: The Extreme Chassis Cooling System is a highly experimental cooling subsystem for Superheavy 'Mechs. By deploying a fast expanding non-newtonian ferro-freeze fluid controlled by nanorobotics, a large part of a large 'Mechs chassis can be turned into instant heatsinks. The system can be undeployed as soon as cooling levels return to nominal. If deployed for any longer time, the chassis will take permanent damage and go through a complete cryo-induced failure leading to the total destruction of the 'Mech. EXTREMELY VOLATILE!

content.original: Once the news of the new Arachnid design reached the Society, they could of course not let some upstarts in the Inner Sphere beat them in 'Mech development and therefore started a refitting project. The first result was the Z version, mounting three Large Supra Lasers, two Hyper Velocity AC/20 and two Large ER Pulse lasers, and the Superheavy variant of the Torso mounted Cockpit. The design struggles with heat buildup from its weapons, but this is not unusual for the Society's designs and just something any piloting MechWarrior will have to adapt to. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.47

content.original: Since the modifications of the Z design focused on showcasing the Society's weapon designs rather than actually being useful, the result wasn't very different from the already existing loadouts once out on the battlefield. To prove once and for all that they were the better 'Mech designers, the Society then came up with the highly experimental Arachnid ZX variant, using all their fanciest technology. Two Arrow V launchers, two Heavy Gauss Rifles and a center torso mounted Light Ultra Gauss Rifle all combine to create a quite capable long range weapons profile. The combination of the Society specific Ferro-Carbide Shell armor and Endo-Titanium structure together with the brand new and still experimental Improved Superheavy Torso Cockpit really showcases the R&D capabilities of the Society, but the lack of any close range weapons besides a single ER Large Laser meant that even the ZX fails to fully impress on the battlefield. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.49

content.original:
The Arctos ACT-1 has a clear long range damage profile with its two Heavy Gauss Rifles and iATM-9 launchers. It does still mount a combination of Medium ER Pulse Lasers and Medium Supra Lasers for closer engagements, but the variant suffers at close range battles. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.45

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
The Arctos ACT-2 uses a combination of the recently created Society MRM-60 launchers and optimized Heavy Gauss Rifles to give a more balanced damage profile than the ACT-1. The major downside of the variant is the fact that all its weaponry is ammunition dependant, making it not ideal for long engagements. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.45

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
Just like the ACT-1 and -2, the ACT-3 uses Heavy Gauss Rifles as its base weapons, together with two Hyper Velocity Autocannon 10. Since these weapons are not adequate for short range defense, two Medium ER Pulse Lasers were added for secondary fire capabilities. The final set of weapons are two Tesla Rifles, allowing the 'Mech to disrupt any enemy forces' internal systems. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.45

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

Four iATM launchers are used for indirect fire support purposes, but just like the ACT-1 this variant suffers greatly at short ranges. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.45

content.original:
The Arctos ACT-5 carries a full on iATM setup. The four launchers with 12 tubes each means a total of 48 missiles can be fired at any enemy with great precision. The only Arctos with Boost Jets allowing it to jump and a larger engine, its mobility allows it to reposition easily for the next missile salvo, flanking slower superheavies with ease. A single head-mounted Snubnose PPC provides some non-ammunition dependent backup firepower. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.45

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: The Doom Turtle is an attempt at creating a mobile fortress out of a superheavy QuadMech. Designed by the brilliant but sometimes over-creative minds of the Society, it is the true pinnacle of what you can do with a QuadMech. Using a specifically designed custom Ferro-Carbide Lammellor armor ensures the Quad can take anything short of a direct nuclear hit and just shake it off. Packed with the latest weapon technologies from the Society, the Doom Turtle brings twin Heavy Gauss Rifles and MRM-60 launchers, a Small Supra Laser and a Snubnose PPC. Quirk: Superheavy Prototype Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.6

content.original:
The B configuration adds some more anti-infantry capabilities by mounting two Rotary AP Large Bore Gauss Rifles (RAPLBGR) and a Small Supra Laser besides the four iATM-12 launchers. To be able to fit all the weapons, the cooling has been reduced to only 13 heat sinks, making the 'Mech slightly vulnerable to heat buildup. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.37

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
The ninth and final configuration of the Leliourium, named after the original demon king 'Belial', is also the most controversial. Replacing a lot of the technology with acquired clan versions - mainly from the Society's laboratories - leads to some Demi-Precentors feeling it is a blasphemy to use such a Mech. But when it comes to the actual battle, the Domini will pilot it like any other 'Mech; using it to bring the word of Blake to the rest of the galaxy. Quirk: Wrath of Blake Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.47

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
The ugly duckling of the Ophanim line, the Caelestis configuration uses captured Clan technology to attempt surprising foes with its unexpected weaponry. Two Improved Large Heavy Lasers and four Light Ultra Gauss Rifles lets the configuration do well at long or medium ranges, but the lack of any short range weapon does leave it slightly vulnerable at shorter ranges. Quirk: Divine Fortress Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.37

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni
